units.title: Cell and bead co-encapsulation in DisCo
units.text: We found that on average, 91.4% of all droplets contain a cell and a bead, and only 1.7% contain an independent cell doublet (Fig. 1f).
units.rationale: This is a quantified, actionable step describing the efficiency of cell-bead co-encapsulation in the DisCo system.

units.title: Cell capture efficiency measurement
units.text: We processed cell numbers of between 50 and 200 cells, of which 74.9% (s.d. ±10.7%) of input cells had more than 500 unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) per cell (Fig. 1j).
units.rationale: This provides a specific, measurable protocol step for evaluating cell capture quality in low-input samples.

units.title: Impedance-based cell counting for input validation
units.text: We quantified the number of input cells using impedance measurements, which enabled accurate counting of the number of input cells as validated by microscopy (Extended Data Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: This describes a validated method to accurately determine input cell numbers, critical for reproducibility.

units.title: DisCo processing speed at different cell concentrations
units.text: At a higher cell concentration of 20 cells per μl, the processing speed could be increased to 350 cells per hour, although with a decreased capture efficiency of approximately 75%.
units.rationale: This outlines a specific operational parameter adjustment and its trade-off, forming a protocol decision point.

units.title: Comparison with Fluidigm C1 platform
units.text: We performed similar experiments involving 38, 125 and 215 HEK 293T cells on DisCo’s closest competitor system for low cell input samples: the Fluidigm C1 platform (Table 1).
units.rationale: This describes a direct comparative protocol step to benchmark DisCo against an established system.

units.title: Species mixing experiment for library quality
units.text: Initially, as a library quality measure, we performed a species mixing experiment of human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T and murine immortalized brown pre-adipocyte (IBA) cells.
units.rationale: This is a specific experimental protocol step used to validate library quality in scRNA-seq workflows.

units.title: Chip-based cDNA generation protocol
units.text: With the drastically reduced bead amounts contained in the generated sample emulsion, we used our previously developed and characterized chip-based complementary DNA generation protocol23.
units.rationale: This references a specific, reproducible protocol for cDNA generation adapted for DisCo’s low-bead conditions.

units.title: Time-dependent cell stress assessment
units.text: We also assessed time-dependent effects on the quality of the single cell data by analyzing HEK 293T cells that were loaded on our system (at 22 °C (room temperature)) for 0–20, 20–40 and 40–60 min. Furthermore, we sampled cells that were stored for 120 and 180 min on ice.
units.rationale: This details a controlled protocol for evaluating the impact of processing time on cell integrity.

units.title: Machine-vision-based blob detection for cell tracking
units.text: The development of a machine-vision-based approach utilizing subsequent image subtraction for blob detection (Extended Data Fig. 1b);
units.rationale: This describes a key technical protocol step enabling deterministic cell capture via automated imaging.

units.title: Precise droplet volume control via valve pressurization
units.text: the precise pressurization of the dropleting valve to enable accurate control of droplet volume (Extended Data Fig. 1e and Supplementary Video 1).
units.rationale: This specifies a critical operational parameter for ensuring consistent droplet formation in the DisCo system.
